business.headline: Gold, silver price today, October 14, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today October 14, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

HDFC Bank shares rise 2% ahead of Q2 results. What should investors do? HDFC Bank share price: Investors are showing increased interest in HDFC Bank shares, anticipating a positive performance in the upcoming quarterly results.
Explained: Why DMart shares plunged 9% in early trade todayThe sharp decline in shares came after DMart's second-quarter earnings failed to meet the market's expectations.
Sensex jumps 500 points, Nifty above 25,000; Wipro, HDFC Bank gain The S&P BSE Sensex was up 409.75 points to 81,791.11 at 10:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 126.45 points to trade at 25,090.70.

Succession Wars: The Hinduja family's bitter battle for controlAt the heart of the Hinduja family's success was their ethos of shared ownership, but this same principle ultimately sparked their multi-billion dollar feud, endangering an empire built on unity.

Boeing to cut 17,000 jobs as losses deepen amid factory strikeThe planemaker will also delay the delivery of its first 777X jet by a year. Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg said that the comapny must shrink its workforce "to align with financial reality".

Fortunes soar: India's richest cross $1 trillion mark amid market rallyForbes' analysis shows that India's 100 richest individuals now have a total net worth of $1.1 trillion, more than doubling their wealth since 2019.

From Trent to Titan: Noel Tata's journey to the top of Tata TrustNoel Tata, born to Naval Tata and Simone Tata, has been a key figure in the Tata Group for many years. He holds several senior positions within the conglomerate.

Nariman Point's revival: Office rents expected to nearly double by 2030The report, titled 'South Mumbai – A Renaissance', attributes this expected surge to ongoing infrastructure improvements and rising demand for premium office space in the area.

Noel Tata on being named Tata Trusts Chairman: Will carry on legacy of Ratan TataNoel Tata was named Tata Trusts Chairman after a board meeting held in Mumbai on October 11, where the decision was unanimously agreed upon by the trustees.
Financial crisis looms in Delhi as extra spending tips city into revenue deficitSeveral departments have underscored additional resource needs, which strain the budget further.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as foreign investment fizzles; Tata Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 230.05 points to close at 81,381.36, while the Nifty50 declined by 34.20 points to end at 24,964.25.
Tata group stocks surge 3% as Noel Tata takes charge at Tata TrustsNoel Tata's appointment came after the death of Ratan Tata, former chairman of Tata Sons, on October 9 at the age of 86.

Appointed Chairman of Tata Trusts, Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata Noel Tata has been appointed as the new Chairman of Tata Trusts, effective October 11, following the death of his half-brother Ratan Tata on October 9 at the age of 86.

Who is Noel Tata, new Tata Trusts Chairman and half-brother of Ratan TataNoel Tata has made significant contributions to the Tata Group's growth and success. His strategic vision, coupled with his deep understanding of the group's businesses, has enabled him to play a key role in driving innovation and expanding the group's global reach.

Noel Tata to succeed Ratan Tata, unanimously appointed Chairman of Tata TrustsNoel Tata has been a part of the Tata Group for over 40 years. The appointment was made during a meeting held in Mumbai and was unanimously agreed upon by the board of Tata Trusts.

Mehli Mistry, Noel Tata lead race to become Tata Trusts chairman: ReportNoel Tata is already a trustee in the Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and the Sir Ratan Tata Trust, which together hold a 66% stake in Tata Sons, the holding company of the Tata Group.

Rupee falls to all-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Garuda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Online guide to check statusGaruda Construction and Engineering IPO allotment: Investors who have bid for the IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as financial stocks drag markets; Tata Steel up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 65.89 points to 81,545.52, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 1.35 points to 24,997.10

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Why Mumbai Police is unable to get gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's custodyLawrence Bishnoi is lodged in Sabarmati Central Jail in Gujarat. His gang has claimed responsibility for the murder of NCP's Baba Siddique.

Hundreds protest after 1 killed during UP clashes, family refuses to cremate victimUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Aditynath has taken note of the communal clashes in the state's Bahraich district and called a meeting with senior officials to discuss law and order in the district.

No toll for cars, SUVs entering Mumbai from tonight: Eknath Shinde's big moveAhead of the Maharashtra Assembly polls, Chief Minister Eknath Shinde announced that light motor vehicles need not pay toll at Mumbai's five toll booths.
Protest in Secunderabad after idol vandalised, BJP's Madhavi Latha detainedThe Goddess Durga idol at the Muthyalamma temple in Secunderabad was allegedly desecrated, and locals caught the miscreant.
Genetics and food: The science behind premature hair loss in menPremature hair loss in men is commonly linked to various factors including genetics, diet and lifestyle.

When Ratan Tata was caught between a CM and militantsIn the late 90s, when militancy was at its peak in Assam, there was a storm in the Tata Tea cup. Then Assam CM Prafulla Kumar Mahanta alleged Tata Group's links with militant outfit Ulfa. Then came the leaked Tata Tapes. This is the time when Ratan Tata led the group through a crisis and emerged unscathed.

Video: McDonald's worker fails to recognise Bill Clinton. What happened nextWhile campaigning for Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris in Georgia, former President Bill Clinton stepped into a McDonald's, only to find the employee at the counter failing to recognise him.

2 IndiGo flights to Jeddah and Muscat from Mumbai get bomb threatsAccording to an IndiGo spokesperson, flight 6E 1275, en route to Muscat, and flight 6E 56, headed for Jeddah, both received bomb threats.

SpaceX can re-launch Super Heavy rocket within an hour of its returnThe Super Heavy booster was caught by the launch pad's mechanical arms, affectionately referred to as "chopsticks", just seven minutes after lift-off from Boca Chica, Texas, on Sunday.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

Rahul Gandhi to review Congress's preparedness in Maharashtra after Haryana lossCongress MP Rahul Gandhi will meet Congress leaders and review the party's poll preparedness in Maharashtra ahead of the upcoming Assembly polls slated to be held later this year.

MLAs from Manipur's warring groups to meet for 1st time since start of violenceA year after the ethnic clashes, Meitei, Kuki, and Naga MLAs of Manipur are set to hold peace talks in Delhi on Tuesday. Over 200 people have been killed in ethnic violence in Manipur since May 2023.

Hina Khan nearing last cycle of chemotherapy, posts pic of 'last standing eyelash'Actor Hina Khan shared her experience of losing eyelashes due to chemotherapy. She remains positive, using her "last standing eyelash" as motivation and wearing 'falsies' for shoots.

New AI scam targets Gmail users with fake account recovery requestsA sophisticated AI scam targeting Gmail users has emerged, tricking individuals into approving fake account recovery requests to steal personal data. IT consultant Sam Mitrovic shares his encounter with this scam, detailing the deceptive tactics used to gain access to users' information.

Baba Siddique's murder accused not a minor, bone test revealsA bone ossification test ordered by a Mumbai court revealed that Dharmaraj Kashyap, an accused in the murder of NCP leader Baba Siddique who claimed to be a minor, is an adult.

Bengaluru man slams Swiggy Instamart for sending 'sneaky' free tomatoes. See postA Bengaluru man's post sparked a debate online about consumer choice and "dark patterns" after he lashed out at Swiggy Instamart for not providing a removal option for freebies that come with an order.

Aishwarya-Abhishek's candid family moment in Anant Ambani's wedding documentaryThe documentary Valley of Gods, Jamnagar showcases Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant's Hastakshar Ceremony. It features Bollywood stars like Abhishek and Aishwarya Bachchan.

Bigg Boss 18: Donkey removed from show after PETA urges makers, Salman Khan Following PETA's plea to remove Donkey, also known as Gadhraj, from Bigg Boss 18, the show's producers complied by eliminating the animal in the most recent episode.

Netanyahu considers 'surrender or starve' plan for northern Gaza: ReportThe General's Plan, proposed to Netanyahu and the Israeli parliament, aims to starve out Hamas militants and force them to surrender by cutting off essential supplies to the population in northern Gaza.

Bengal BJP MP accused of pushing, beating seer at ashram; tension grips townBJP Rajya Sabha MP Anant Maharaj allegedly pushed and beat up a seer during an argument with him at an ashram in West Bengal's Cooch Behar district. The MP has refuted any incident of assault.

Actor Neena Gupta posts pic with granddaughterActor Neena Gupta shared a heartfelt photo of her newborn granddaughter, expressing her immense joy. Her daughter, Masaba Gupta, and husband Satyadeep Mishra, welcomed their baby girl on October 11.

US to send THAAD anti-missile system to Israel to boost defences amid attacksPentagon spokesperson Pat Ryder said the deployment of the Terminal High-Altitude Area Defence (THAAD) battery would augment Israel's integrated air defence system.

'Fast-unto-death' continues over Kolkata rape-murder, 4th doctor hospitalisedA protesting junior doctor was admitted to a hospital after his health deteriorated during a fast-unto-death over the rape and murder of a trainee doctor at West Bengal's RG Kar Medical Centre and Hospital, taking the total number of junior doctors who have been hospitalised in the course of their fasting protest to four.

2 Dalit girls gang-raped in Jharkhand while returning from Durga Puja fairThe incident, which took place on October 11, only came to light on Sunday evening when the survivors and their family members lodged a complaint with the police, according to a police officer.

BTS' Jin to release debut solo album this NovemberBTS member and singer Kim Seokjin will soon be releasing his solo debut album, music agency Bighit Entertainment stated. The rest of the six BTS members released their albums in 2022 and 2023.

Malayalam actor Bala arrested on ex-wife Amrutha Suresh's complaintMalayalam actor Bala was arrested by Kerala police on October 14. His ex-wife Amrutha Suresh accused him of insulting her on social media.

Kanye West accused of sexually assaulting ex-assistant: ReportRapper Kanye West has been accused of sexually assaulting a former assistant. The incident reportedly took place during a studio session co-hosted by rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs.

Martin box office Day 3: Dhruv Sarja's actioner faces shocking drop on SundayMartin, starring Dhruv Sarja in an action role, witnessed a steep drop in its collection on Sunday. This was unexpected, considering it opened on a good note at the box office.

Infinix Zero Flip: Infinix to launch its first flip phone in India on October 17Infinix is ready to launch its first clamshell smartphone in India. The Infinix Zero Flip will enter the Indian market on October 17. Here is what we know so far.

Digital arrest scam is rising and here is how you can save yourself from this threat The digital arrest scam is a rising threat in India, with scammers using fear tactics to exploit victims. Here is how to identify and protect yourself from these sophisticated online frauds.

Moto G85 selling at Rs 15,999: 4 reasons why this is a great deal Moto G85, launched in July, has been praised for its premium design, smooth performance and long battery life. And all of these specs come bundled at a starting price of Rs 15,999, during the Flipkart Big Shopping Mahotsav sale. But is it worth it? Yes, let's find out.

IT consultant Sam Mitrovic shares his encounter with this scam, detailing the deceptive tactics used to gain access to users' information.

sports.headline: Babar Azam dropped: Nasser Hussain says England won't mind Pakistan's callNasser Hussain feels that England would be pleased to have seen Pakistan drop Babar Azam for the remainder of the Test series on Sunday, October 13. Babar has been struggling with his form in Tests.

Ranji Trophy: Easwaran continues Test team push with century vs UPRanji Trophy: Abhimanyu Easwaran continued to knock on the door of the Indian Test team with a century against Uttar Pradesh in the first Ranji Trophy match of the season. This was Easwaran's 4th hundred in the last 4 games.

Shashi Tharoor welcomes Sanju Samson with 'ponnada' in ThiruvananthapuramCongress MP Shashi Tharoor presented Sanju Samson with a blue shawl after the superstar wicketkeeper returned to Thiruvananthapuram.  Samson hit his maiden T20I hundred on Saturday in Hyderabad in India's record-breaking win over Bangladesh.

Pawan Sehrawat Telugu Titans' hope for revival in season 11After struggling in the past few seasons, Telugu Titans will be looking at Pawan Sehrawat to lead their revival in season 11 of the Pro Kabaddi League this year.

Djokovic ends 2024 without Grand Slam, calls it his 'worst-performing season'Legendary Novak Djokovic has called the 2024 season as one of his worst-performing ones. Djokovic finished 2024 without a single Grand Slam but won the Olympic gold medal by beating Carlos Alcaraz.

England interim manager Lee Carsley remains coy on taking full-time jobEngland's interim boss Lee Carsley has remained coy about taking the full-time job after their UEFA Nations League win over Finland on Sunday, October 13. Carsley has lost just one game since taking over from Gareth Southgate.

Steve Smith will not open in Test series vs India: George BaileyAustralia batter Steve Smith will not open the innings vs India, confirmed Australia chief selector George Bailey. The announcement comes nearly a month ahead of the first Test match of the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

Hasan Ali backs 'brothers' Babar, Shaheen and Naseem after Pakistan axeHasan Ali has backed 'brothers' and 'champions' Babar Azam, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Naseem Shah to bounce back after the trio was dropped from the Pakistan squad for the remainder of the England Test series on Sunday, October 13.

Babar Azam vs Virat Kohli comparisons are baseless: Brad HoggFormer Australia spinner Brad Hogg shunned comparisons between Babar Azam and Virat Kohli after the former was dropped from the Pakistan Test side. Hogg said that dropping Babar was the right call from Pakistan.

UEFA Nations League: England return to winning ways with 3-1 Finland winEngland bounced back from their loss against Greece with a convincing 3-1 win over Finland in the UEFA Nations League on October 13, Sunday. The Three Lions won the match 3-1 to get their campaign back on track.

Pat Cummins returns as captain as Australia announce ODI squad vs PakistanAustralia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins return after his break as the world champions named their ODI squad against Pakistan. Australia will take on Pakistan in a 3-match ODI series.

Pat Cummins returns as captain as Australia announce ODI squad vs PakistanAustralia Test and ODI captain Pat Cummins return after his break as the world champions named their ODI squad against Pakistan. Australia will take on Pakistan in a 3-match ODI series.

Wish Pakistan all the best against New Zealand: India coach Amol MuzumdarIndia coach Amol Muzumdar sent his best wishes to Pakistan ahead of their clash against New Zealand on Monday, October 14. The Indian team will need a favour from Pakistan if they have to qualify for the semifinals of the Women's T20 World Cup 2024.

India can still qualify for semis after Australia loss. Here's howWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: India lost to Australia by nine runs in Sharjah on Sunday, but Harmanpreet Kaur's women are still in with a chance of making their way through to the semi-final.

IND vs AUS: Cameron Green out of Border Gavaskar Trophy, sidelined for 6 monthsAustralia suffered a big blow ahead of the Border Gavaskar Trophy as Cameron Green has been ruled out of the 5-match Test series against India. Cricket Australia confirmed the news on October 14, Monday with Green set to undergo surgery and be on the shelf for 6 months.

Harmanpreet Singh, Hardik Singh attract big bids on HIL auction Day 1 The Hockey India League 2024/25 Auction saw Indian stars and international talents attract record-breaking bids, with franchises spending Rs 16.88 crore on 54 players, highlighting the demand for top drag-flickers and goalkeepers on Day 1.

Pakistan Board disgruntled with Fakhar Zaman for questioning Babar Azam's removalPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is unhappy with Fakhar Zaman's post on his X account questioning the removal of star batter Babar Azam from the squad of the ongoing Test series against England.

Australia don't depend on one or two people: Harmanpreet after India's lossIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur criticised her team's lack of collective effort following their 9-run defeat to Australia, highlighting this as the key difference between the sides in a crucial Women's T20 World Cup clash.
SL vs WI: King, Lewis help West Indies go 1-0 up with 5-wicket win in DambullaWest Indies beat Sri Lanka by five wickets in the first T20I of the three-match series to go 1-0 up in the series.

India in danger of early exit after losing thriller to AustraliaWomen's T20 World Cup 2024: Harmanpreet Kaur's India lost to Tahlia McGrath's Australia by nine runs in the group match in Sharjah. India's fate now depends on the clash between Pakistan and New Zealand on Monday.

Michael Vaughan calls current Pakistan team the worst to emerge from the countryFormer England captain Michael Vaughan has called the current Pakistan team teh worst ever to play for the country.

Bangladesh name Emon, Hridoy in squad for Emerging Asia CupAkbar Ali will lead Bangladesh in the Emerging Asia Cup. Towhid Hridoy and Parvez Hossain will also represent the A team in the upcoming tournament in Oman.

Yamal leaves Spain camp for Barcelona despite being cleared of injuryLamine Yamal has been released from Spain's national team camp as a precaution after suffering minor discomfort during the Nations League match against Denmark, although medical tests confirmed no significant injury.

Why was Phoebe Litchfield not given out LBW vs India? Explained   Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Phoebe Litchfield wasn't given LBW by the third umpire despite her trying to play a switch hit and changing her stance in the match against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
